title: Yohimbine for erectile dysfunction: a systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized clinical trials
study_type: Systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized trials
results_summary: This systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized trials evaluated yohimbine in men with erectile dysfunction. Results showed that superiority to placebo with infrequent serious adverse reactions in short-term trials; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Yohimbine for erectile dysfunction: a systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized clinical trials.” PubMed, 1998, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/9649257/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Double‑blind, placebo‑controlled safety and efficacy trial with yohimbine hydrochloride in nonorganic erectile dysfunction
results_summary: This randomized double-blind placebo-controlled trial evaluated yohimbine hydrochloride in men with nonorganic erectile dysfunction. Results showed that higher response rate than placebo with generally mild adverse events; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Double‑blind, placebo‑controlled safety and efficacy trial with yohimbine hydrochloride in nonorganic erectile dysfunction.” PubMed, 1997, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/9315493/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Double-blind trial of yohimbine in treatment of psychogenic impotence
results_summary: This randomized double-blind controlled trial evaluated yohimbine in men with psychogenic impotence. Results showed that improved clinical global impression compared with placebo in nonorganic cases; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Double-blind trial of yohimbine in treatment of psychogenic impotence.” PubMed, 1987, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/2887726/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Effects of yohimbine on sexual experiences and nocturnal penile tumescence and rigidity in erectile dysfunction
results_summary: This randomized double-blind placebo-controlled study evaluated yohimbine in men with erectile dysfunction. Results showed that subjective improvement in nonorganic cases without significant NPTR changes; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Effects of yohimbine on sexual experiences and nocturnal penile tumescence and rigidity in erectile dysfunction.” PubMed, 1996, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/8714425/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Efficacy and Safety of Oral Combination of Yohimbine and L‑Arginine (SX) in Treatment of Mild to Moderate Erectile Dysfunction
population: Married men aged 25–50 with mild to moderate erectile dysfunction
results_summary: This randomized double-blind placebo-controlled trial evaluated combination of yohimbine and L‑arginine in men with mild to moderate erectile dysfunction. Results showed that improved IIEF erectile function domain versus placebo with similar tolerability; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Efficacy and Safety of Oral Combination of Yohimbine and L‑Arginine (SX) in Treatment of Mild to Moderate Erectile Dysfunction.” PubMed, 2010, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/22952481/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Yohimbine as a treatment for erectile dysfunction: a systematic review and meta-analysis
population: Men with erectile dysfunction across randomized trials
results_summary: This systematic review and meta-analysis evaluated yohimbine alone or in combination in men with erectile dysfunction. Results showed that improved erectile function versus placebo with heterogeneity and older trials noted; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Yohimbine as a treatment for erectile dysfunction: a systematic review and meta-analysis.” PubMed, 2021, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/35118966/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Yohimbine in erectile dysfunction: the facts
results_summary: This narrative review evaluated yohimbine in men with erectile dysfunction. Results showed that summary of clinical evidence suggesting modest benefit and need for modern RCTs; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Yohimbine in erectile dysfunction: the facts.” PubMed, 2000, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/10849568/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Yohimbine in therapy of erectile dysfunction
results_summary: This review evaluated yohimbine in men with erectile dysfunction. Results showed that concluded superiority to placebo with fewer side effects than invasive treatments based on then-available RCTs; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Yohimbine in therapy of erectile dysfunction.” PubMed, 1998, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/9522535/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Pharmacology and safety considerations for yohimbine in humans
results_summary: This narrative safety review evaluated yohimbine in adults exposed to yohimbine. Results showed that potential for hypertension, tachycardia, anxiety, and drug interactions; caution advised; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Pharmacology and safety considerations for yohimbine in humans.” PubMed, 2001, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/11550783/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Adrenergic mechanisms and penile erection: effects of yohimbine
results_summary: This clinical pharmacology study evaluated yohimbine in men undergoing laboratory erectile testing. Results showed that physiologic enhancements consistent with alpha‑2 antagonism; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Adrenergic mechanisms and penile erection: effects of yohimbine.” PubMed, 1984, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/6147098/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.
